Reviews.Title: “Concert overnighter”
Reviews.Author: jlmaryon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as a last minute thing so that we could have a drink at a concert at Alexandra palace. Did not know what to expect as last minute and really cheap ... But was presently surprised .. The rooms are very basic but they are clean and have all the basic amenities in them .. The location is good for wembely and Alexandra palace. Value is excellent and there is free parking on site. If you treat this place as a stop over then it definely does the job. Staff where friendly and although there are very little facilities on site you are on a busy highway where you can get pretty much all you need. Good value cheap hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: Juleey
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the reviews given here I was afraid of staying at this hotel for 4 nights. To my surprise the fear was fading the moment I finally entered the room (we had a family room on the first floor). In comparison to many other hotels and even to some that got much better reviews our room was pretty big. All of us had lots of space to enjoy the stay there! Besides, and probably the most important aspect, the room was absolutely clean! The staff was always nice and helpful. The breakfast was delicious as well. All of us were extremely pleased with what we got, especially due to the little money we had to pay. The only negative aspect that needs to be mentioned is that a fire alarm can easily be set off (due to steam *haha* -which can be avoided by closing the bathroom door immediately!). Concluding I have to say that I would definitely and without any doubt stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Dana687
Reviews.Content: I have only read the reviews after my stay ar King Solomon Hotel. I had a wonderful time and very good experience at this hotel. The staff was very helpful - they have helped me with the directions and also printed some documents for me free of charge. The room was nice and warm, bathroom looked recently decorated and the bed was very comfortable. That's the main things that are important to me when I stay in the hotel. Breakfast was different but I think everyone can find what they like to eat for breakfast- there were different cereals, eggs, toast, butter, jam, tomato salad, tea, coffee, hot chocolate. I have stayed in different hotels in London and the service wasn't that good as at King Solomon Hotel. Please don't expect 5 star accommodation for the price you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!!!”
Reviews.Author: kateharris30
Reviews.Content: one night here was more than enough. went with friends and they had a broken bed, we had a freezing room with no heating in january! when we complained all we got was a heater. staff unhelpful and uninterested. complained by email to them afterwards, no response so they just dont care. duvets were rubbish so we couldnt slep very well with the cold. breakfast was stale bread for toast, squash, cheap horrible coffee, cereals and for some unknown reason salad and tuna!!!!!!!!!! who has salad and tuna for breakfast!!! this is not the continental breakfast we were promised. really bad hotel. facilities poor, staff useless and breakfast disgusting. i am just annoyed we paid for this terrible hotel. only good point was location to london. dont book if you want to sleep!!!!!!!!!!or eat!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for budget travellers”
Reviews.Author: Ã�gnes T
Reviews.Content: I didn't expect too much, but King Solomon is a very good, friendly and clean one. The breakfast is better than in a 3star hotel. Location is also fine.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Experience”
Reviews.Author: roneill82
Reviews.Content: A friend booked this "place". We are no longer friends. This is not a hotel. Finding the room was an experience with a maze of hallways and a range aromas to accompany the journey. Would not recommend this place. Rooms were run down, breakfast was terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Underrated Budget Accomodation in London....”
Reviews.Author: Christian W
Reviews.Content: Booked a room at the King Solomon for two nights over the holiday period for some last-minute Christmas shopping and I was pleasantly surprised. Reading some of the reviews, I was a bit hesitant, but the hotel is well-located, clean, and functional. Rooms were tidy w/ flat-screen TV's and the breakfast was in a light, airy cafe---they even serve bagels! The hotel is located on a leafy road with a nice business district + great Tube access. Definitely a good budget hotel option in London!

Reviews.Title: “great for our needs.”
Reviews.Author: RFS29
Reviews.Content: 4 of us booked a family room at the King Soloman for an overnight stay. We arrived 2 hours before check in but was told 5 minuters and the room is yours. 2-3 minutes later we were in our surprisingly roomy and spotless room. 2 flat screen TV's tea and coffee making facilities small sofa couldn't ask for more. Breakfast was in a comfortable dining area and was perfectly acceptable for the price we paid. I felt I had to write the review as some of the reviews here were unbelievable. I have now stayed at 2 hotels which have received scathing reviews on Tripadvisor both totally unfounded. In short no complaints whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: blondie2302
Reviews.Content: Me, my sister and my 2 daughters stayed here on Saturday 10th December 2011 as we had tickets for the X Factor final at Wembley Arena, we arrived at 12.30 even though we knew check in was 14.00hrs, on arrival we we greeted by a very nice guy who told us "I'll see if your room is ready" within minutes he came back and told us it was and we could check in. Our room was on the ground floor which we found quite easy, on entering the room the heat hit us but as it was a bitter cold day we wasn't complaining. When we opened the door it lead into a small sitting area with a small sofa, chair, fridge and table complete with a kettle, 4 cups and saucers and plenty of coffee, tea, sugar and milk, through another door was the bedroom, the room was quite small with 2 double beds, which were very comfortable and a decent sized wardrobe, the beds were separated by 2 bed side units. The bedding and towels were lovely and clean, so was the bathroom When we arrived back later that evening it was still red hot in the room, however we telephoned reception and asked if they would come and turn the radiators down, within 5 minutes a very nice young man came to the room and sorted it. Breakfast was lovely, I have never tasted Scrambled Eggs like it and the salads were divine. All the staff were friendly and very attentive. This hotel was perfectly situated for the bus to Wembley and also a short distance from Golders Green tube. We all agreed for the price and location this hotel was perfect and we would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “love juice on bedding!! Dont need to say more but....”
Reviews.Author: opshie86
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, bathroom light switch could not be detected, so called reception, whilst discovering the tv does not work either and no remote. Staff came up, but did not know what he was doing so asked someone else to come in. light sorted but no tele! Apparent aerial failure on the roof though only ours is affected. Bathroom floor tiles are a major hazard, chair is extremely unstable. A pigeon nested just outside bathroom window, and window seems to just lead to a gap in wall between rooms. No towel rail, wooden blocks holding u bend and sink up. Cables hanging everywhere. Everuthing looks old and grotty. Then upon gettin into bed, I find what can only be described as human secreation, a large amount too so dont know how they missed it. Dont b fooled by the pictures, the restaurant is a separate business that just happens to be within same building, and is hardly ever open, its friday night and no bar open :/ no lamp or switch by bed, so out into the cold after settling. Positives- twin room containing two rather comfy double beds. And you get towels! This weekend was a birthday treat hhhmmm next year im goin to ask for dvds

Reviews.Title: “This place is aweful”
Reviews.Author: KaiEvs
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel because it was convent and not too expensive!! The place was absolutely disgusting!!! The carpets smelt on the way up to my room. Got in my room and even though I paid for a double bed I was given a single, I went to complain and was told no double rooms available and was not even given the difference between a double and single (was told to write a letter). When in the room I pulled back the covers to find faint blood stains on the sheets absolutely filth. Next morning walked into the breakfast area and I would have had food poisoning if I eat in there (cook with no gloves and long fingernails actually handling scrambled egg with her handsâ€¦. Please take it from me and donâ€™t stay there!!!

Reviews.Title: “I'm sick they have my money”
Reviews.Author: Euroerican
Reviews.Content: Last month, I had the unfortunate opportunity of staying at the King Solomon hotel in Golderâ€™s Green, an area of London, England. Had I known what I was to experience, I would have never booked my stay there and I would have warned anyone considering the misfortune - which I am about to do now - of ever even entertaining the thought of staying there. While I admit that London is one of the worldâ€™s most expensive cities, and you would be hard pressed to find anything less expensive than around eighty Euro per person/night at a hotel - Iâ€™d honestly rather spend a little extra (and Iâ€™m a very frugal person) than ever stay in a place like this again. If I were forced to look at the hotel from the perspective of the glass being half full, then I would say that the bed was comfortable, there was soap provided, the shower was clean and there was a functioning TV. These are the most positive attributes I can adorn the sorry excuse for a hotel, and the management is lucky that I say as much as this in a kind light. Having not read the former lodgersâ€™ reviews online prior to my stay, I had no idea what I was about to encounter upon my arrival. I was only going to be in London for one day and night , and I had an important meeting the next morning at East Finchley Tube station, and needed to find a hotel that was in the vicinity to where my meeting point was to take place. I found only so many hotels online that were in proximity to East Finchley Tube, and one of them was 'King Solomon'. It was the most economical hotel, and seemed to be the only thing available - and now I know why. Upon arrival at 11 AM, I approached the entrance of the hotel with a bit of trepidation, noticing the area which I was in, was not the nicest. I also paid close attention to the fact that it was a Jewish establishment- catering primarily to Jewish patrons, which included the menu in the restaurant. To be fair, I did not pay attention to the name of the hotel - which may or may not have been a give away - but I think they could have made mention of the fact that it is geared mainly to Jewish clientele, as to not make other guests feel out of place. When I entered the hotel, I was stunned to see a completely different looking lobby area than what I had seen on the website. It was in utter chaos; The entrance was small and cramped, there was one small loveseat- like pleather sofa, one chair and desk. To the right was a door, and to the left, also a door. The woman behind the counter greeted me, but was not overly friendly. I smiled and said I had a reservation to which she cut me off and said, â€œItâ€™s too early to check in.â€� I tried to give her the benefit of the doubt, hoping that their would be actual customer service. â€œThatâ€™s alright,â€� I continued, â€œwhen is check-in?â€� â€œNot until 2 oâ€™clock.â€� She said matter-of-factly, and with a look I didnâ€™t appreciate either. She looked away from me, and continued doing whatever it was she was doing behind the desk. â€œAlright. I need to go do some things, may I leave my bags here?â€� She said, â€œOf course.â€� pleasantly enough, and proceeded to take me through door number one on the right. There was a very dark, narrow hallway and some cupboards on the left hand side. She opened the cupboard and told me to put my things in a fairly cramped space where some other guestsâ€™ baggage was already being stored. I felt a little bit under pressure, as I needed to get some things out of my suitcase to take with me, and there were people waiting to get through the hallway - but not enough room to pass me, as the hallway was so cramped. Iâ€™m not sure if it was someone who worked there, or just a guest, but a man who had come through the same door as us a moment later, began flirting with me in a very uncomfortable fashion, to which the receptionist quipped, â€œDonâ€™t bother the customers.â€� He made another flirtatious comment toward me, which I ignored, whilst taking the things I needed, as he pushed up against me to get by. He didnâ€™t mind, but I did. I grabbed a few of my items, and closed the locker. She asked, â€œOkay?â€� In a friendly enough tone, and I reluctantly said, â€œYeah.â€� She walked behind me as we left the unattended and unlocked locker. Wait - isnâ€™t that an oxymoron? I asked her if they would be locking the locker, to which she responded very apathetically, â€œYeah, yeah, I will.â€� She, again, looked away from me as she said it, continuing to work on whatever she was working on behind her desk almost unhappy that I was there. I asked her politely if I could use the bathroom, to which she said again in friendly enough tones, â€œOf course.â€� She then began explaining where the bathroom was, and I lost her, but tried to find it anyway. I did get lost - albeit Iâ€™m not the best with directions, but even so it shouldnâ€™t be that difficult to find a lobby hotel bathroom, especially that tiny of a hotel - and I had to go back again to ask her. â€œYou didnâ€™t understand?â€� She asked surprised and a little annoyed that she had to explain once again. She tried, and upon seeing that I was losing her again in the direction process, had to force herself to get away from behind the desk, and probably had to bite her tongue not to say what she was thinking, and showed me herself. The bathroom, I discovered, was through two different hallways, and in another section of the hotel altogether. I can scarcely begin to describe the magnitude of disgust and fear that came over me when I saw where I was going to be staying, and where the restaurant was in all this madness. The whole downstairs area seemed as though it were under construction, but then I came to the conclusion that this was just its normal state. Dirty, dusty, colorless and drab. The door to the left of the reception was where the madness begins. Out of that door, you proceed into a long, curvy, narrow hallway. Through the last door, it leads you outside. You walk to your right to get to the restaurant, and you walk straight on to get to the other section of the hotel where you can find the bathroom. After a few twists and turns back to the reception desk from the bathroom, I managed another smile and so did she, and I asked if I could come back much later that evening, as I didnâ€™t know how long my day would be. She said that was fine, just as long as it was any time after 2 PM. I thanked her for her help, and then reminded her to lock the locker - which I donâ€™t think is an unreasonable request - to which she replied, â€œI will.â€� in the tone of a teenager responding to a motherâ€™s request to make sure she cleans her room. My day in London ended in the evening, and I was back at the hotel at approximately 7:30 PM. By the time I came back, new staff was at the front desk, a young man in his twenties from Romania. The girl that had helped me earlier was also in her twenties, with long dark hair, she seemed to be Israeli, but I could be mistaken. The man that was on duty now, was cordial enough, but didnâ€™t know who I was, and I had to explain that the girl beforehand had left my luggage in the locker. Without even checking identification or giving me a number to match the luggage beforehand, he accepted my statement as fact, and took me into the back and let me collect the luggage myself. He found me on the computer with my reservation, checked me in, and proceeded to escort me to my room. He said the room was on the way from where the luggage was. I had my luggage in hand, and could see that there were rooms on that floor. However, my room was not. He led me through a long and winding hallway, which had a total of four doors (including the one that led from the receptionistâ€™s desk to the first hallway), a long and winding staircase (also narrow), and finally up to the floor where my â€œroomâ€� awaited me. At first, he did not want to help carry my luggage - actually refusing to do so - and after he saw that I was having difficulty keeping up and because he had made a mistake and led us up the wrong staircase at first - he finally picked the bags up and aggressively said, â€œHereâ€�, and led the way. When we did arrive inside the room, Iâ€™m fairly certain my jaw actually touched my toe, for I was in shock with the size of the room. I felt very much lied to, and I was seriously starting to believe I had accidentally booked with the wrong hotel. â€œOh my gosh,â€� I thought to myself, â€œdid I remember the wrong website? Did I book with a different hotel, than the pictures Iâ€™d seen?â€� No! This was the â€œrightâ€� hotel. And more than anything, I was pissed off. Not because the room was so small. Not because the hallways were so narrow - certainly not because I could hear the neighbours all night and also the next morning, and also when they peed and flushed the toilet - noâ€¦I was pissed off because Iâ€™d been lied to. This was not the room they showed on the internet. I was extremely tired from my trip and from my day, and the last thing I needed was to get into an argument with an eastern European downstairs, but this is what it had come to. It was not my fault. I trotted downstairs, trying to pay attention to where I was so that I wouldnâ€™t lose my way going back up. I needed to get something to eat anyway, so I thought Iâ€™d kill two birds with one stone. I go talk to the front desk and then also get a bite to eat in the restaurant. Not knowing of course, what was on the menu. I walked up to the desk and in a serious, but not altogether rude manner I asked to speak with the manager, â€œWhatâ€™s the problem?â€� He asked, as if he didnâ€™t know. â€œThe room I have, is not what I requested. A mouse couldnâ€™t live in there. And I feel very deceived because of the pictures on the internet.â€� He checked the reservation politely enough and said, â€œYeah, you booked a single room - and thatâ€™s a single room.â€� â€œThatâ€™s not the picture on the internet.â€� â€œWell, we donâ€™t take pictures of all the rooms.â€� â€œOh, so you only take pictures of the nice rooms, and then say that thatâ€™s what they all look like? Thatâ€™s a little deceptive, donâ€™t you think?â€� He shrugged his shoulders. It really wasnâ€™t his fault. â€œIâ€™d like to speak to the manager, now.â€� â€œWell, the thing is,â€� he began, and I already didnâ€™t believe him. He looked down, and then back up at me, â€œSheâ€™s giving birth in these days, so I donâ€™t know when sheâ€™ll be in.â€� â€œShe doesnâ€™t have a phone.â€� He shook his head â€˜noâ€™. â€œWell, when will she be in again?â€� â€œMaybe tomorrow at around 9:30.â€� I thought ahead, I would have just enough time to ask for my money back, but then I would have to skedaddled for my meeting. â€œRight, okay.â€� I thanked him and then asked him if the restaurant was still open. He politely told me where to turn and that yes, they were still open. The restaurant was very nice, I must say. Very tasteful, with nice lighting, nice music, a bar evenâ€¦what I didnâ€™t realize was that the menu was not up to par, to at least, my own standards. I looked over the menu, and the friendly waitress which gave me time to sit down and agreed to package whatever I ordered up so I could take it back up to my room, came and checked on me and helped me with the few questions I had. I tried to find the least expensive thing on the menu, but that sounded desirable, and I went with the ravioli. I asked her what kind of meat it came with, to which her friendly smile drooped to a horrified perplexity. â€œWe donâ€™t serve meet at this restaurant. Only fish. This is a kosher restaurant.â€� And then gave me a look as though I should know this. I was more than disappointed with the meal, which was over 10 pounds, not a small amount of money, and ate a total of about five bites because it was inedible. I was very upset about that as well. That same night, when I went back to my room, I tried calling down to reception, but the phone did not go through. I couldnâ€™t get a line. I had to go all the way back downstairs to ask the receptionist if he would please come upstairs to help me with the TV as it did not work. When he came up, he had to leave the front door open, as there was not enough room for the both of us to fit in the tiny room. The bathroom was an interesting adventure as well. To take a shower, you had to manoeuvre yourself very strategically in getting in. It was literally the tiniest bathroom I have ever encountered in my life. The next morning, when I approached the front desk once again with my bags in tow, ready to check out and try their free breakfast with stay, there was once again a new face behind the counter. Another man who tried dodging the fact that the manager was in fact in. I told him I had a complaint, and he wanted to know what it was regarding. I told him as well that I felt I had been deceived and I wanted to speak to the manager. He pointed her out to me, and when I finally managed to have a discussion with her, she was not rude but not friendly. She coolly told me that she would check my reservation while I had breakfast and she would see what she could do about a refund. I was pleased with the effort - or at least with the reported effort. I went into the restaurant once again, to find a buffet of food which, in my opinion, was inedible. All kosher once again, there were things like tuna fish with corn, burnt coffee which I took one sip of, and some other strange concoctions I couldnâ€™t even stomach to look at early in the morning, let alone try to eat. I skipped breakfast and went back to the reception desk. To the receptionist of the night be foreâ€™s credit, she was in fact pregnant. She informed me that she could not provide me with a refund because I had booked through a booking site, and not directly through their hotel. She offered - and albeit, qualified it first by saying that it may not be something that I would want to do, but - if I would like, she could offer me a free stay the next time I am in London, in one of their best rooms. I accepted, as this seemed to be the best she could do, but I wasnâ€™t happy with the alternative to a refund. She asked for my e-mail address. I have yet to receive that gift voucher.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but..”
Reviews.Author: Alex_G1984
Reviews.Content: It is a nice hotel, the stuff is very helpfull and friendly. 10 minutes away (by foot) from a Tube and Bus mini central station. 10 minutes away from a local pub. But, the rooms are not very clean. We got double bed room with 2 single beds, and when we tried to move them, we found a very dirty carpet. The bathroom was very small. So, accept those things, the hotel is nice. BTW the food is Kosher

Reviews.Title: “So uncomfortable, hot stuffy :(”
Reviews.Author: eli2012
Reviews.Content: Hi, im sorry but im really angry i paid the `standard rate` of 50 per night (thats almost 100 dollars, and will anywhere else in the country get you a nice posh room.. here not so much the case) i stayed for 5 nights --250 pounds the place advetises internet but doesnt say that if you want it for 24 hours its 9 pounds! so i spent almost an extra tenner a day (45 pounds) on internet alone!!! something most places have as a basic addition to room for free!!! the rooms, were scorching hot! after 11pm, even with the windows open it was so hot, it was almost impossible to sleep! it can not be blamed on the weather as it was actually raining outside! i was so miserable every night there and wished to God i hadnt paid all that money! oh and the eastern european manager woman at the desk mornings and most days has a BIG attitude, she`s all smiles until she gets your money, then she couldnt give a dam and makes even so much as answering a question seem to be unwanted contact!

Reviews.Title: “the worst we have ever experienced and would not recommend it”
Reviews.Author: ArchwayNanch Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: the room was so small my partner had to keep his head at an angle so not to hit it off the curved ceiling and breakfast was lettuce lettuce and more lettuce

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!”
Reviews.Author: dharaparekh
Reviews.Content: I chose it because of the location as I had work in that area. There is nothing I liked or would recommend at this hotel. I read mixed reviews about this hotel on various websites but because I didn't have any other choice I booked it. I would like to point out that the pictures put up on the website are misleading.Even hostels have better infrastructure than this hotel. The experience was even more bad because of the exorbitant rates charged by this hotel. The 'continental breakfast' consisted of bread that was stale (both the days that I was there, the bread was stale), coffee tasted weird and even the salad wasnt fresh. The way to reach the room was more like back passages of a run-down factory.I Stayed in single room and without exaggeration, the bathroom was tiny and smelled foul.There was a switch for the water heater but no hot water in the shower.

Reviews.Title: “cheap and very very basic but clean and staff were excellent”
Reviews.Author: ann65dublin
Reviews.Content: Had a two night stay here this month. I picked it as it was close to Middlesex University . When we arrived i was shocked at how delapidated it was and contemplated changing hotels. The bathroom had all been recently refurbished so that wasn't to bad and upon futher examination the beds and rooms were old but clean. We decided to stay and were glad we did as it was the perfect location for what we wanted we were only sleeping there and the beds weren't bad. However the staff were freindly and obliging and for the money which was 30 euro each per night i'm not gpoing to complain. though i would not stay there again as I firmly beleive that you get what you pay for !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Total rip off - vile and disgusting”
Reviews.Content: I booked a twin room online at twice the price my friend paid for a triple days before. On arrival we had to ask to be moved as the stench of sewage coming from the bathroom was overpowering. The second room didn't smell as bad to start with but by the time we got in later in the evening it was again stinking. The shower door would not open because the light fitting was in the way, the shower was black with mould, the walls were running with grease and grime, the furniture was stained and the carpet was thick with dust. The breakfast was inedible and quite frankly after a night there I could not bring myself to eat anyway. The whole place stunk of damp, mould and cigarettes. I absolutely categorically would not recommend spending one minute in this disgusting hovel.

Reviews.Title: “A terrible experience!”
Reviews.Author: abbott_kim
Reviews.Content: We had an awful experience at this hotel. We booked a twin room but was allocated a double and given no other choice, just told the hotel was full. The corridors smelt of cigarettes and were generaly dirty. The room was very basic and depressing, the bed was on an iron frame, no head board, every wall was covered with stains and dirt. The bathroom had no window and the shower cubile covered in mould the door could only be opened 10 inches as it hit a ceiling light. There was a smell of sewers from the bathroom, by the morning after having the door shut all night it was so bad we could not use the bathroom, There was a sky light that had no cover on it and the second sky light just looked out to the roof tops. The cups were covered with black soot that had come in from the window. We had no choice but to stay in the room as there was no others available and as we were under time pressure to get to Wembely to see Take That, we were really stuck. They had also taken our money when we checked in. The next day we asked to speak to the manager, was told she was in a meeting and that there was nothing anyone else could do. The receptionist took our number, of course we heard nothing. WeI have written to the hotel, asking for a full refund,. We paid Â£85 for the room, a disgrace!! There does seem to be two parts of the hotel, friends stayed in front, even though the rooms were basic they seemed better, the older back half of the hotel, which is where we stayed should be pulled down!

Reviews.Title: “Awful..do not waste your money”
Reviews.Author: iamdobbie
Reviews.Content: Went to see a Take That concert in Wembley and this was the only hotel that the four of us could get into without paying over Â£150 per room. Room was like a steam box and had to walk up 3 flights of stairs as the lift was broken. Only one power point in room and the shower was broken, complained on arrival and still nothing was done by day of departure. Breakfast..was what they call continental style consisting of tuna, egg, cucumber and tomato salad..oh yes there was cereals and toast...friut juice was in fact orange squash..!! The ony good point to the hotel was the fact we only stayed 1 night !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerfull”
Reviews.Author: bluenwhite17
Reviews.Content: A few communication problems when checking in as the hotel is run by all foreigners, the room was okay very basic. the shower leaked and when my friend went to open the bathroom door the handle snapped off. The breakfast was terrible it consisted of toast,tuna,cheese and hard boiled eggsthats about it. the location is pretty decent plenty of places to eat and get out around, its also on a good bus route.

Reviews.Title: “They should Pay You To Stay”
Reviews.Author: EXAMINER86
Reviews.Content: What a dump. No lift so you have to walk up very steep stairs. I had a front facing room but the bed had been turned round so it was not possible to watch the TV in bed. The room was cold with no heat.I told reception about this but they never fixed it. Every time i went to the cupboard i banged my head on the low wall. The breakfast was uneatable.Egg that tasted off,stale rolls,and foul tasting coffee. I had booked for 2 nights but i missed brekfast the second day. The only good thing is the area. I got a lovely breakfast the next day at a cafe on Golders Green Rd. Anyone who says this hotel is good with good food must be on drugs,or they have never been anywhere. For an extra few pounds you can stay in a decent hotel in central London. I only stayed there because i thought it was close to where i had to work,but never again. It is better to take the tube each day.

Reviews.Title: “dont stay in this hotel - substandard condition”
Reviews.Author: nrodrig
Reviews.Content: This hotel is totally substandard. Our 2 days there were the worst hotel experience of our life. We paid a ridiculously high price for a double room that was terribly filthy: the walls were stained with something that could be any fluid imaginable, there was mold in the windows and particularly in the bathroom walls; the carpet was so disgusting that we had to use sandals, the smoke alarm went on every time you took a shower, and the breakfast was a shame.

Reviews.Title: “dont stay on a thursday.... its closed”
Reviews.Author: rangersloan Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night on business only room available at alst minute what a shame its just not worth the trouible, The room smells, the pillows smell, there are bugs in the bathroom and the bedroom, its just not a nice pace to stay. the tv only has 3 channels Its more like a doss house than a hotel, no one spoke much English, and residents were more like refugees Definatley a place to avoid, even the brekfast was poor, bread was dried and stale , orange juice was like colured water the only good thing was the coffee and that because with the exception of the hot water you did it all your self

Reviews.Title: “cheap hovel”
Reviews.Author: Radziord
Reviews.Content: The price was the main attraction as we had to stay close to Hendon.Tiny, filthy room. No good points, no comment.

Reviews.Title: “I've stayed in better hotels costing $1 in Vietnam, at least then you expect this level of hygene.”
Reviews.Author: Nephtis
Reviews.Content: Where to start. The good points. The location is good and the parking is for free. The bad points. The room smells horribly of smoke. The sheets may be clean but the smell is in the pillows and duvet. The doors slam loudly at night. The management seem more bothered in blaming the staff than in resolving the issues. The room is covered in a layer of grime, the construction is cheap and shoddy and in places falling apart. The shower did not work, stuck on blindingly hot. We should have looked at the reviews more closely- but convenience led us here. It will not again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, friendly hotel in a good part of North London”
Reviews.Author: Howser7345
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel since November 2010 as I am working in London on a medium to long term contract. I used to stay at The Holiday Inn Express and only stumbled accross this hotel when the Express was full. Now I won't go back! The King Solomon may not be as posh but it represents much greater value for money. Clean rooms, free parking, a great location for food and drink, plus first rate staff all add to a very pleasant stay at The King Solomon.

Reviews.Title: “good, fair prices, friendly, well-maintained - would definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: emma_best
Reviews.Content: we will stay here again. we were in town for a very stressful period of time, and found the hotel a great retreat from stress etc. if we needed to make urgent phone calls, the cleaning and maintenance staff were very understanding, good-humoured and flexible about coming back later. the front desk staff were calm and sensible. the rooms were attractive; if we came back to London for a more positive experience, such as a holiday, we would definitely consider coming here again. there seemed to be a nice atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: glitzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzz
Reviews.Content: We booked King Solomon for one night because it was the cheapest we could find. Bearing this in mind, I was impressed. It was clean and comfortable. Small, but FINE. Breakfast was included (always a winner in my book), there's free parking and the staff were friendly. My one complaint: you can hear everyone moving around, all the time...which can be irritating. All in all I think it is important to remember that in life you get what you pay for! If you want better, pay more :) Also: If you're going to use the word awful, learn to spell it.

Reviews.Title: “WHATEVER YOU DO, DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: RO25
Reviews.Content: Easily the worst place we have ever stayed. I have stayed in some dingy places while backpacking in Australia and NZ but this place gets first prize for the smelliest little hole I have ever stayed. The guy at reception was like Shmeegel from Lord of the rings. An unhelpful little greaseball. The room was about the size of an average hotel rooms' bathroom. There was no proper window. Just a tiny little skylight above the bed. I was hitting my head on the ceiling it was so low. My girlfriend was taking a shower and the shower knob came off in her hand. The toilet didnt flush. The place was filthy and smelled of damp and mould. We both slept in our clothes as the bed was disgusting and had stains all over. There were large holes in the floor under the carpet big enough for your foot to fall into. We had booked for 2 nights but luckily only paid for one. We checked out after the first night and both agreed that one day we could at least look back and laugh at just how bad it was. We kept the card from the hotel and it is now displayed in our living room. Without doubt the worst hotel on earth and I'm not exaggerating. Run while you still can

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value of money,very friendly staff and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: elena46_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located with all the necessary amenities for business people, as well as families and tourists. The hotel is very clean. Every morning, all guests can enjoy an inclusive (in price) kosher breakfast. The receptionists are polite and always there to help guests. The cleaners and all staff are correctly behaved, friendly and understanding of the needs of each guest. The hotel has Frankie's restaurant where a guest can enjoy a lovely kosher meal in the evening. Also the hotel provides free parking for guests who enjoy to travel by car. The hotel has excellent transport links to Central London, City and the suburbs. Two tube stations (Brent Cross and Golders Green) are just a short walk or bus ride away. Golders Green High Street - just a couple of minutes by walk. I will recommend this hotel to my associates and my friends with pleasure. I enjoyed my stay in the King Solomon Hotel very much.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Howie34
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in King Solomon Hotel for a week, it was nice and clean room, friedly staff and tasty breakfast. I am comoong back the next month again

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: kevinlyman
Reviews.Content: This place was the worse hotel I have ever stayed in . firstly they hadn't got a family room after phoning up 3 weeks before , the receptionist was very rude . They finally gave us a big room and put in extra beds . The toilet leaked , but they wouldn't do any thing about untill the next day, the plugs and light switches were exposed. The window was cracked . There was only on sheet on the matress , so we all slept in our clothes .Next morning a man outside our window repairing the flat roof with a blow torch at 8.00am. The breakfast room was a building site . The best part about staying here is going home . It should be demolished or reported to the enviromental and health and saftey departments of the uk .

Reviews.Title: “what an aweful place”
Reviews.Author: greenlineLondon
Reviews.Content: possibly the worst hotel ive ever stayed in, saw signs of vermin outside, the food wasnt fit for pigs and the staff were most unhelpfull, would rather have spent the night in the bus stop down the road, never again. if heath and safety paid a visit they would have a field day.

Reviews.Title: “KING SOLOMON....its junk”
Reviews.Author: crewdog19135
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't stay in this hotel again if they paid me 1,000 euros a day. There is construction going on in front of and behind the hotel. Its close to a busy street as well. It has got to be the absolute loudest place I have ever stayed in. Every single door in the place SLAMS shut each time its closed and when they are being opened it sounds like somebody is ripping duct tape off the wall. Rooms aren't in the best of conditions either. Huge cracks in the walls in my room. The towels they give you to wash with STINK. Enough...go somewhere else for your own good...you'll thank me.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel i've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: rhonda009
Reviews.Content: .shower groating orange dirty tiles black mould on white grouting broken wall lamp bedside lampshade tatty thin frayed carpet between bed and bathroom no sink plug could feel bedsprings++ scribbling on wall dirty skirting

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Room 63”
Reviews.Author: madcurator
Reviews.Content: We were given room 63 which is right next to the italian restaurant next door. The extractor fan noise was deafening!!!! It went on until at least 11.30pm and then started again at 6.30am. The bathroom light does not work, frayed towel on bathroom floor as floor mat, the bedside light spins around 360 degrees with a very light touch. The room was nothing like the one shown on the internet. The staff are not particularly friendly. The TV signal was shocking, unable to watch at all. When I reported it in the morning I was told that the engineer had been yesterday and had not returned to fix it...... I was not convinced. As for breakfast avoid it and go to the Imperial Cafe just down the road for a lovely cooked breakfast. The location was ideal for our purpose but I wouldn't stay here again....ever! King Solomons Hotel.......more like King Solomons Mine - the room was tiny!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel for short stay not very far...”
Reviews.Author: Douglasdoright
Reviews.Content: Ideal hotel for short stay not very far from central London. Free parking is a real bonus. Not the best hotel on the world but comfy and very reasonably priced. One small critiscm. No mirror in bathroom. Why?

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money, free parking, good for access to attractions”
Reviews.Author: tomsinclair
Reviews.Content: Value for Money, free parking, good location for access to London attractions, easy access driving down from the North Shower had some staining or mould in the grout between tiles, but otherwise clean and functional. Breakfast of cold tuna with sliced tomato and cucumber, cold boiled eggs seemed strange to me. However cereals and milk, toast and choice of jam were also available.

Reviews.Title: “makes Fawlty Towers looks like The Savoy”
Reviews.Author: rozzer23
Reviews.Content: All six of us agreed that the is hotel was the worse we've ever stayed at. Asked for extra pillows and were given pillows without cases. The maid took away our towels after the first night so after we went to a concert on the second and wanted a shower (which was cold) before bed we were unable. Rooms were stuffy, beds were uncomfortable and staff unhelpful. My younger brother explained to the receptionist that the door to the room was not lock and the receptionist said not to worry about it...

Reviews.Title: “Very Basic, Tiny Room, Noisy and Insecure - Not Recommended”
Reviews.Author: scubadigger
Reviews.Content: I booked a single room, with ensuite for a week while working in london. Good Point Shower room was very clean and ample hot water Bad Points Room was so small you could not open the door to the shower room without moving other furniture. Shower room was so small you could not sit straight on the toilet. London was having a warm spell so it was essential to open the bedroom window in order not to suffocate, however this meant being subject to the noise of a large group of children and young adults who appeared to be staying at the hotel virtually unsupervised, shouting, singing, banging doors and generally being extremely inconsiderate until past 11pm each night. The bed was wedged into one end of the room so tightly that to fold the sheets under the mattress you needed to lift the entire mattress while leaning over it, and the sheets were too small for the bed so every morning I woke up with virtually no sheet under me sleeping on the mattress. The fire alarm went off at 3am one morning, but there was no checking by the staff that guests had evacuated, and in fact after what seemed like 15 minutes of alarm it switched off. As far as I could see non-one left their rooms, and no-one checked. The following morning the alarm board was still bleeping as if it had not been reset. Exterior fire exit doors were left propped open, allowing anyone to wander into the hotel from the street, consequently I didn't leave ANYTHING in my room except clothes as I didn't think it would be safe.

Reviews.Title: “I would go back”
Reviews.Author: Nottinghamboy
Reviews.Content: I booked this due to price - it was the cheapest - but I was anxious due to the bad reviews on this site. However, I was pleasently surprised. The room was big enough, light airy and fresh (no smells!). It was clean and the bathroom was good. The breakfast was what I would have expected and was more than adequate. Free parking and location ner to tube was adistict advntage. I was particularly careful to note the staff at every opportunity as they have been heavily criticised here. Either they have completely new staff or people are unreasonable. They were friendly and helpful. My wife is fussy but she was happy with our stay. Bottom line: value for money.

Reviews.Title: “disgusting”
Reviews.Author: shell299
Reviews.Content: I can't believe we actually paid to stay in ths awful place............. BATHROOM.... dirty, shower full of mildew and someone had covered up the mouldy grout with silicone which was falling off !!!!! No mat on the floor, just a hand towel !!!???? why a towel i ask my self? , shelf above hand basin and toilet roll holder falling off wall . ROOM .......tiny...we had a family room , 2 double beds, we were under the impression there was 2 singles as we have a boy and a girl, who really are not keen on sharing a bed !!! beds, reasonably comfy, slept on worse.. romm had been recently painted and absolutley stunk, i am glad none of us suffered with asthma as there would have been a major problem. BREAKFAST ....omg !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! no organisation, to make a cup of tea you had to walk to 3 different parts of the dining room , not very wise when young children are walking around....if you like tuna and sweetcorn, egg mayonaise and tomato ,cucumber and red onion for breakfast you will love it .... otherwise its boring toast bagels and cereals , if you are lucky you may get a boiled egg which is hotttttt .

Reviews.Title: “hotel - hahaha thats a joke for a start!”
Reviews.Author: lancezarke
Reviews.Content: dump - how do i even start - the staff should have been exhibits in madame tussauds - the room was the size of a matchbox- the window was broken - the toilet handle fell off on numerous occasions - the tv which was probably made in 1842 didn't work - if toast is your preference for breakfast - then join the queue of ravenous toast stealing rude guests. the decor in the room makes fawlty towers look like the ritz - i will never ever ever go back to this hole ever again. the best thing about the hotel was the road to the tube station. errrrr we even had to ask for clean towels on a daily basis - do these people never wash!!

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: Vislor_Turlough
Reviews.Content: I went to work in Golders Green for 18 months and the first hotel I chose to stop in was the King Solomon. Okay it was reasonably priced. It was not a pleasant experience. On the plus side it is reasonably priced and has a good location. On the minus side the hotel is shabby, the rooms dirty, every room I stopped in had a problem with it be it the shower head, the TV, the bed linen, the towels. One left the shower feeling dirtier than when one entered. The staff on reception were generally unhelpful and in some cases rude. Every week when I checked out they demanded to know if I had made any phone calls, not asked, demanded. The walls were paper thin so some nights you could hear people in the room next to you talking on the phone. The last week I spent there I was around the corner in another house they had. The room was even dirtier, the bed was not made for 3 nights and the towels not changed.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, no frills”
Reviews.Author: Guinness1970
Reviews.Content: Having seen previous reviews, we stayed here with trepidation, but had no choice as other hotels in area were fully booked. It's really not that bad. Yes the room was basic, reception staff fairly disinterested, breakfast not to our taste. However it was clean enough, and very cheap..we only paid Â£59 for a double with free parking. There was a decent pub just down the rd called the White Swan, which served reasonably priced and not bad food. The tube is a few minutes walk at Golders Green and just one stop to fashionable Hampstead with its nice bars and restaurants and Euston about another 10 mins further. If your looking for the ritz and staff falling over themselves to help, forget it. However it's fine as somewhere to get your head down and to explore London.

Reviews.Title: “very good value for money , defo back again”
Reviews.Author: SammyNaas
Reviews.Content: ok i'll make it quick . before i airved to it i read so much about it evey one saying bad stuff about it and so , i was first not sure but i gave it a try , and honestly i arived frindly fast welcome i paied he showed me the way to my room as it's not easy to get to it . the room was nice and big enough with a duoble bed as i requested with a bath in the bath room. good breakfast and the location is sooo good . the bad things about the hotel first the hot water in the morning runs out quick as every one is having a shower , the towles the first day i had 4 , the next day i had 3 then 2 then 1 . lol ( i stayed for a week ) . one night the room next to me were having a gang bang party i heared every thing as if it was in my room ..lol as for the room key each day i had to reprogram it for some stupid reason . other then that the hotel is very good and i will defo be back to it

Reviews.Title: “rude owner , never to britain again because of him !!!”
Reviews.Author: maya_gabriela
Reviews.Content: don`t stay here unless you are rude enough to give the right answer to the people working there and to their boss . take your brekfast with you , they are going to comment on your presense in the restaurant . my first time in britain and never come back because of this rude people . if you are on holiday stay anywhere else , or better go to another country .

Reviews.Title: “Nice and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Alex_J0nes
Reviews.Content: 24h reception which meant we could get there past 11pm and get a warm welcoming by their friendly staff.Nice rooms, comfortable and spacious. The bathroom was modern and with a great shower ! Breakfast was seriously good (which, considering we were there for a race event nearby, was most than appreciated ! ). Located on the highway of one of London's loveliest districts.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there”
Reviews.Author: matt4848
Reviews.Content: The lady at reception was polite enough, but the male staff were obnoxious, rude and aggressive. I was â€˜told offâ€™ by one male for parking where I was told to! The room was vile, obviously someone had been smoking as it stunk of cigarettes and damp. The electrical cable for the fridge was taped to a different plug - slightly dangerous?! (I found it rather funny that the fridge was due for its next test in March â€™09!! â€“ almost a year out of date!) The TV had 2 channels and the aerial cable was bare! There was no headboard on the bed â€“ it looked more like a hostel. The room was a good size but all the fixtures and fittings were very, very poor. Bathroom tiles were dirty and the floor was sticky. The breakfast was just awful. Orange squash being served as â€˜orange juiceâ€™ â€“ how rude. Just a few cereals and bread that they refused point blank to toast for me. Donâ€™t stay here, I know itâ€™s cheap but you get what you pay for! I wish I had stayed n the Travelodge I was considering!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value place that is often misunderstood”
Reviews.Author: patisson
Reviews.Content: King Solomons gets a bad rap for unfair reasons. It is a budget hotel and cheaper than just about any of the competition. For the price it is excellent value. Some of the rooms are better than others, but they are generally clean. I found the staff to be pleasant and helpful, but they are sometimes put under stress because of the different types of clients they get: both mainstream people looking for a reasonable deal of specifically a kosher hotel and people out for a cheap dive who may be getting drunk or behaving in other undesirable ways. With so many complaints about the breakfast, I should say that the food is really top notch for a bed and breakfast in this price range. The bagels are great, and there's plenty of cereals. As to the salads so few people understand, well, Israelis like them and so do some of the North London crowd -- this is a kosher establishment and so they focus on providing something painfully lacking in London, a place where a Jewish clientele feels at home. And, frankly, the Jewish clientele really isn't into bacon or pork sausages for breakfast! I am living away from London right now and am quite happy to stay at Solomons. You do get what you pay for, and there are very few places that provide a clean room and a nice breakfast at this sort of price!

Reviews.Title: “Basic”
Reviews.Author: sallylamb
Reviews.Content: Very basic hotel -stayed there one night in the family room - looks like some improvements being made. Had tv and ensuite and sheets clean - room only had a small window looking out onto a wall! Breakfast was ok - bit strange - tuna mayo and egg mayo, toast, bagels, cereals and salad. Receptionist with the long dark hair was very friendly and helpful. Location was good and tube only 10 min walk away. Good having on site parking

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: barbiegirl_001
Reviews.Content: We have only stayed there one night and thank god for that because I couldn't have stayed for a second one... The location of the hotel is not bad, only a few minutes walk from the underground station. We stayed in the cheapest room (55 pounds) and it was awful. The room was stinking of fags, there was no TV and not even a bin!! The curtains would not close properly, so we had to use a hairclip to keep them together, the door kept shaking and creaking everytime someone walked past it and i know this is not the hotels fault but this drunk woman came at 2 am and she would not shut up! the breakfast was quite good. Overall, it was not a very pleasant experience

Reviews.Title: “Terrible reception service”
Reviews.Author: pamelawalt
Reviews.Content: I advise anyone who is making plans to stay at this hotel.(Don't) the reception service there is terrible.I neva experience anything like this in my whole life,this was the biggest nightmare I ever had.The reception service gives you poor customer service,they are very grummpy and disgustin,this is the worst recption customer service I have ever gotten in my life.The internet service service is poor cant even get online only if you come to the reception area then when you're there trying to use the internet its so small they run you out.Them is so grummpy and full of stress there please dont go there to spoil your vacation or stay.my advise is for u guys to get good customer service training.u will need it for the furture.

Reviews.Title: “after all, it wasn't bad.”
Reviews.Author: le-grex
Reviews.Content: Of course, it's hard to get a hotel in London, if you're on a budget. So we decided for 2 single rooms in King Salomon. Well it's everything else, then being central, but hey, i like a nice journey by the tube. The breakfast was very OK, eggs, cereals, white bread and rolls, strange salads (tuna), but also cheese, jam, chocolate cream and so on. The rooms were not large, but clean, although the walls could get a new paint. But i'm sleeping there, not living. I would maybe come back, but since London is such a large city, i would also test another hotel. Staff was very very friendly and helpful. Ask for a room upstairs!

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience ever”
Reviews.Author: PiaEsbjerg
Reviews.Content: The room was small and very poor. It is the worst hotel I ever stayed at. It was so cold inside and the bathroom was so small and so not nice. The breakfast was the "best" part of the this hotel. I will not recommend anyone to stay there...............

Reviews.Title: “Cheep and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: burntbiatch
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner were going to watch an oasis concert on the Sunday so we thought we would make a weekend out of it. We had read all the reviews and had to say we were a bit wary as they are all negative. However on arrival we were very suprised as the hotel was very nice and the staff were lovely, polite and helpful. The room was a bit small but it was adequate as you got what you payed for. The room was very clean and the maids maintained the room every morning. It was a very friendly place with easy access into the town and London centre. There were a few negative points though as we didnt like having to pay for the room up front, just in case there were any problems. Also it was noisy on a night up until early hours of the morning, this is mostly down to the occupants of the other rooms not the hotel. other than that it was a lovely place and we really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Cheap place to crash for girls or lads weekends.”
Reviews.Author: ChellDerby
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fine there is nothing wrong with it for the price you pay. It is clean the beds are ok. The breakfast is a little weird with there being Tuna and salad but you could have plenty of toast cereal tea and coffee., just no fry up. You get what you pay for we paid Â£20 each including breakfast for that price it was fine. We requsted a fan for our room and one was dleivered straight away I really don't think the staff are rude. If I wanted a romantic weekend with my boyfriend I wouldn't stay here but for groups its great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & friendly staff - Good value - you get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: bazzamac29
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a group of friends when we were going to a Take That Concert at Wembley. It was perfect for what we needed - cheap and cheerful. It was clean and the staff were friendly. It was a baking hot day and we asked for a fan and it was delivered to the room within minutes - what more can you ask for?! Rooms were fine, we only needed a shower and bed for the night and it served its purpose. Yes you do get tuna for breakfast but there are plenty of other choices - and tuna was actually quite nice with a hangover! I would recommend this hotel and we all agreed we would stay here again. Great location for Wembley!

Reviews.Title: “the only good thing about it is its location”
Reviews.Author: tweety14
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for good service, friendliness, obliging staff, (eg requesting a blanket for your cold room only to be told it's possible the following day which was the day I was due to leave), you aint going to find it here!

Reviews.Title: “don't do it.”
Reviews.Author: happygirlEngland
Reviews.Content: Where shall I start... arrived in reception and given a hand drawn map to find our room which took us up narrow corridors (smelly),fire escapes, weird cranky stairs until we finally arrived 20 minutes later to our room as the room numbers did not go up in order for example room numbers 1. 2. 3 .4 .16. 78. 79. 80. 5!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Our room should of been a twin but was a double it was really really hot because the radiator was scorching and surrounded by wood so you could not turn it down. we then took a while to find our way back to reception and was told that we could have another room which was a twin room but between the beds slap bang in the middle of the room was a full size fridge(god knows what was in it). We then had a look at our bathroom and as I opened the shower cubicle the glass door came away in my hand. Also if we had of decided to stay in this room there was one curtain hanging down the middle of a double window(did they expect us to choose which side of the window we wanted it to cover.) We once again went back to reception and the member of staff was getting very moody by this point, she said that was only one room left which was a triple room and so off we went to see what was in store for us this time. After finding our room we was not suprised that it also had lots of faults. Firstly the Double bed, head started at the single beds feet?? The wardrobe was on a slant but was no use anyway as it had no hangers and no pole. The bathroom was filthy with no rails or hooks for towels. When trying to make a cup of tea I realised that not only was the kettle to huge for the sink but also you had to hold it whilst it boiled as It did not reach the table. Out of all the rooms this was the best as we could turn the radiator down. If it was not so late in the evening we would of scarpered from this place but we were really tired after a long day out. After a noisy hot night we looked forward to a hot shower and our breakfast. The shower was more than hot and it scalded suddenly after running luke warm for a while. The breakfast consisted of Cereal, stale bread, egg mayo and tuna mayo and salad. I opted for bread and jam although the jam was not jam it was some kind of sticky sweet wall paper paste with food colouring in as the two different colours tasted exactly the same. So if you are reading this and thinking of staying here DON'T. We think Hollowell prison would be a much safer bet.!

Reviews.Title: “do not stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: hitsp1000
Reviews.Content: it was worst hotel ever i stayed in.we were there for bank holiday. room were okay, but main horror started after 9.00pm, room radiator start making loud noise every 15mins, and carried on for whole night, we try to phoned reception, phone wasn't working, i had to go to the reception, they said somebody will come and check, no one came, meanwhile, noise was getting louder, we couldn't sleep whale night, in morning, we went to see manager, he wasn't help full, i would advise to everyone look some were else. DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE- DISGUSTING SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: marphi
Reviews.Content: I booked a room over the internet for my fiance, as this hotel was in an ideal location, and was the cheapest. Upon arrival, my fiance wanted to confirm the room was paid for in full. He was told no. My fiance telephoned me to tell me I would have to give my card details AGAIN, over the phone. Whilst in the middle of talking to my fiance and just before he handed the phone over to me, he took another call and took another booking and just left my faince standing there in reception. Finally, I speak to him on the phone and ask if I can now pay over the phone- No. I said I would give him full authorisation and would give all my card/ address details for him to take payment. No. He needs my written authorisation. Whilst I am in the middle of talking to him, he decides he has enough and just hands the phone back to my fiance- apparently saying nothing and giving him no eye contact or explanation. Evidently my fiance is not allowed to stay in his booked hotel room. This is absolutely appalling. A brilliant example of TERRIBLE customer service. My fiance had a meeting the following day at 8:00, and there he was @ 9:30pm after travelling up from the south coast after work, only to be told he can't stay in his booked hotel room. So needless to stay needed a room ASAP ... the lovely people at THE REGAL GUEST HOUSE, Golders Green, very kindly gave my fiance a room with no problems- thoroughly reccommend them.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel in the entire world?”
Reviews.Author: richardholman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the misfortune to stay at the King Solomon Hotel for one night at the tail end of our honeymoon. After a wonderful week together in Brighton, we'd decided to stop in London for a night and go to see a show in the West End. We found this hotel online and it seemed to offer a decent price and good, basic facilities i .e. a bed, en-suite, tea/coffee, TV etc. However, my advice to to you is as follows. Unless it's scathing in its criticism, do not believe anything that you read about this establishment. For the owners to even call this a "hotel" would seem, to me, to be an offence under the trade descriptions act. It is nothing more than a filthy, dirty, unhygenic, worn-out, broken-down dump. To be frank, all the adjectives and words of criticism that the English language places at my disposal would not do this place justice. If you haven't heard enough yet, do read on. Firstly, when we arrived we were asked to pay upfront and provide details of our credit cards. This was, with hindsight, a bad sign. We were then given the keycard for our room and directions to find it. We navigated our way up a narrow, creaky staircase behind the reception desk and through a warren of similarly narrow and dingy corridors until we found our room. Ah, the room! The size of the room wasn't too small, but it wasn't particularly large. As it was a hot day and my wife and I had spent about an hour shedding bodyweight and sweat on the underground, we decided to have showers. The shower basin and walls were dirty with mould. Then, despite running the shower for around 20 minutes, I couldn't get any hot water. Then , suddenly, hot water came, but the dial on the shower didn't seem to actually control or alter the temperature of the water. I had a shower and so did my wife. In addition, there was no plug in the washbasin in the bathroom and the plughole was swathed in human hair, which certainly wasn't ours. Then we found the plug for the basin ... sat on top of the little striplight above the mirror. The plug was also covered in hair. Showered and increasingly sceptical, we decided to examine the rest of the room more closely. Firstly, the sheets on the bed, the eiderdown, and the pillows were all dirty. By dirty, I mean that the eiderdown and the sheets had suspicious-looking yellow stains on them - skidmarks? semen? - in a number of places. The pillows also had dirt on them. The carpet hadn't been vacuumed for sometime, it seemed. The tea/coffee facilities included a kettle, two dirty coffee cups, dirty teaspoons and some sachets of tea, coffee, sugar, and milk. All were covered in a layer of dust, as was the tray they sat in. The TV, mounted on a bracket high on the wall, was connected to the mains via an extension cable stretched halfway up the wall - to reach the TV's plug - and hanging free behind the "desk" in the room. Our wardrobe had a safe. Before we went out, I placed my camera in the safe. A good move, methinks. When we went downstairs, we mentioned the dust, the bathroom, the dirty sheets, pillows, eiderdown at reception and asked them to ensure that the room was cleaned in time for our return later that evening. To cut to the chase, that didn't quite happen. The same dirty sheets, pillows, eiderdown etc had simply been turned around, turned-over. No dusting had taken place either. We called reception and asked them to come and do it. A man came up to our room and duly changed the bedclothes. After he left, he checked them and, what do you know, the new bedclothes were also dirty and covered in dubious stains. We called reception asked them to change the bedclothes again. Lo and behold, one set of dirty bed linen was exchanged for another set of dirty bed linen. We gave up at this point and weht to bed without using the pillows, blanket or ediderdown. We were kept awake half the night by a bunch of men - who seemed to be friends of the owners - talking, laughing, shouting on the "patio" below our window into the early hours. Breakfast! What really, really annoyed me about breakfast was, firstly, the poor range or poorly prepared food and drinks on offer. No croissants, no orange juice, just a strange selection of things that, unless you're Jewish, you'd never dream of eating for breakfast. Secondly, and I still get into something of a rage about this when I think about it, the fact that we had to toast our own bread for breakfast. I don't mind doing that at home but, you know, one tends to assume that, at a hotel, when you've paid about Â£65 for a room and breakfast, the breakfast would be prepared by the staff. But, no. We had to toast our own bread, make our own coffee etc. So, to conclude, do not ever, ever, ever even contemplate staying at this "hotel". It is a dump. There's no other way of saying it. As other reviewers have commented, you'd be better off sleeping on a park bench or getting yourself arrested so that you could spend the night in a police cell. When we left, it felt like escaping. This is definitely the worst hotel I've ever stayed in. Just don't ...

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peter_Slovakia
Reviews.Content: We had to stay at this hotel with my colleague. When we came to the hotel, we needed approximately one hour to take a deep breath from what we saw. Our rooms was booked & payed for 2 nights but I leaved to find some other accommodation. My colleague stayed. We met the very next day and my colleague told me his experience from his night-mare night. He had a room at the very top of hotel, when he at last lifted all his stuffs to the room he realized that it's a very small, dark room with no window. Sorry, it had a window - but it looked like a prison window near the roof. Room very smelled, there was splitter bed with dirty covers, in the bathroom there was dirty basin and the water didn't flushed out and the walls was full of moulds. After this experience he decided to change the room. The new room was the same but the bigger window. I came back on the very next day because I didn't find another accommodation for that night, so I had to stay. My room was near to the reception and it was alike my colleague's room. It was also furnished with splitted bed with dirty covers, impossible smelled, dirty basin, water didn't flushed out & walls full of moulds. This room has 3 bonuses: TV didn't work, dirty glasses for tea/coffee maker, and the curtain was very dirty and full of hotes. On the very next morning we was happy that our stay here is about to finish, we packed up our stuffs and went for breakfast. We had egg and tuna. Disgusted from this hotel we finally went home. I will never recommend this hotel - even my biggest enemy!

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but some problems!”
Reviews.Author: formand
Reviews.Content: I was there for two days with a buddy. If a bed is what you want this hotel is good because of the price. But i will not recommend this one to any persons with any kind of body troubles as it is alot of small stairs up to the rooms. They have an ALARM TEST every sunday at 11 AM, its absolutely anoying and took about 20-30 min. And still the alarm went outt twice on sunday evening. Breakfast is ok. however their food seems to be reused the day after if not used (the tuna seemed to be used both mornings and packed away for reuse again later!). The hotel is placed in a very nice jewish quarter, and it is easy to get to it by train, and a bus is driving a yard away from the receptionÂ´. Overall i got what i wanted and nothing more.

Reviews.Title: “King Solomon's Hotel, Golders Green, London”
Reviews.Author: Invivo
Reviews.Content: e As a child, after watching Planet of the Apes on television, i had recurring nightmares, where i'd walk through a deserted city, mouldy and stale, anxious because in each dark passage hidden eyes were peering at me... If you've had this type of nightmares: enhance this dreary feeling of impending doom by a thousand, and you'll get the general impression this hotel left. If you haven't, let me give you some examples of how we liked the hotel. I say hotel, because as you pay to sleep there, it technically is a hotel. If the place were for free, the term 'City dump' or hellhole would be more aptly suited. The corridors, rooms, doorknobs, light switches, toilet, carpets, walls, ... were dirty. I'm talking about years of accumulated dead skin cells, greasy paws, sex fingers, ... not just some superficial grime. Breakfast... now... breakfast... started off well. We were given coffee cups with the Segafredo logo on them. So far so good. The coffee however, was served as granules, and you had to get your own luke warm water. One of the reviews for this hotel, dating back from last year, mentioned a tuna/sweetcorn salad and some other tripe: i think i ate the same actual tuna salad. There was no toast. Ye shalt not make Toast on the High Holy Day that is Saturday (the hotel has Tora scrolls at each doorpost... we know because we opened one, and then smoked the scroll). Unfortunately, on Sunday the breakfast was more of the same. No toast. Not because Sunday is a high holy day for those of the Jewish faith, but probably because the owner/manager is a lazy bugger who can't be arsed to keep up even infinitesimally small standards. Our room did have a radiator. It did not work. We did have a fan though. Our room had a skidmark on the wall. It was well hidden by the cobwebs, but after we cleaned those away, the skidmark was There. It was Always There. Like the Mona Lisa, it followed you through the room. Upon trying to escape the penetrative stare the skidmark, i moved the room's chair out of the way, to discover that it was lodged up against the wall to prevent the skirting boards from falling over. Our only light bulb gave of an eery fluorescent glow and was basically just two electricity wires sticking out of the ceiling, with a bulb attached to it. This was getting a bit too much, so we decided to brake the house rules, and have a siggy through the window. Our room had a view, we were actually looking at a concrete wall that was erected just a few feet from the window. Thank god the windowâ€™s were too dirty to see it. The top 15cm of the window could open, but this took considerable force, as birdpoo had sealed off the seams. The bathroom had - contrary to our bedroom - a window that could open. It obviously could, as it was open. It cannot be closed though. A generous spraying of polyurethane and some cheap foamy insulating material was used to avoid serious drafts in the bathroom. When sitting on the toilet, i could wash my hair in the shower and brush my teeth at the same time. Well, actually i couldnâ€™t, since the tap is was not working and the plug was stuck in the bathroom sink. I did try out the toilets in the bar/breakfast area, that serves as a meeting place for local Jewish people. I got out very fast: no toilet paper and the king of all turds trying to crawl out of the bowl. Conclusions? Iâ€™d love to go back. With a can of gasoline and a few matches.

Reviews.Title: “stay away from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: mysticlady040556
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel in sept 2007 the room we were given was in the extention part of the hotel which meant having to cross thru a wooden fly infested passageway which lead to the resturant at the back. we opened the door leading into the extention to be confronted by a dull and dirty looking corridor. our room was on the first floor our first impression was that the ensuite room was ok, the beds were clean but i found a dirty used towel stuffed down the side of my bed which i thought was bad as this showed the rooms were not cleaned properly. the ensuite was very basic with a tiny shower cubicle which meant banging your elbows off the wall when washing. our first night in the room was ok, but the breakfast was terrible, this is a kosher breakfast but everything is laid out and not covered and there were flies in the room. i had cereal and that was it. when we went back to our room later that nite we were confronted by a foul stench which can only be discribed as that of raw sewage, this was coming from the ensuite and filled the room with this god awful stench even with the window open it didnt help. we had to suffer this for another two nites.this hotel needs upgrading badly and the sewage pipes checked and fixed. my friends have all boycotted this hotel now i would rather pay a little bit extra to stay in a nice clean and fresh smelling hotel which i will be doing from now on. i would not give this hotel a recomendation all i can say is STAY WELL CLEAR OF IT.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Belief...!”
Reviews.Author: Tadpole17
Reviews.Content: Stayed just one night at the King Solomon Hotel as it was ideally situated for the Picnic Concerts at Kenwood House. On arrival, we were asked to find our room (no easy task through a rabbit warren of corridors) and then go back to reception to register! (Finally!) found our room, to discover the roof light had been left open and heavy rain had completely drenched the TV. So... back down to Reception to report this potential hazard, along with the fact that our 'Tea/Coffee making facilities' consisted of 2 cups/saucers and several pods of cream! We requested a kettle, two extra pillows & the TV be checked, and went off to our concert. Later, we returned to find no pillows, no kettle and a TV still not working. We called Reception to be told that there were no extra pillows or spare kettles! At 8.45am next morning, we received a call from Reception to remind us that check-out was 10am & Breakfast ended at 9.30am! ... and they weren't kidding: everything was whisked away on the dot of 9.30am regardless of who was still eating!! The final straw came when we checked out. We pointed out again our dissatisfaction at the lack of pillows, tea-making facilities and the drenched TV. "How do I know that you didn't leave the window open and so ruin the TV?" was the response from the member of staff.... Unbelievable or what??? Certainly won't be staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Seen better, seen worse”
Reviews.Author: Janne_HEL
Reviews.Content: I tried to find a nice and cheap hotel which seems to be very rare in London. Finally I chose this one even I was a little worried because of some previous reviews. I stayed in King Solomon Hotel three nights and find it quite satisfying. There were several things that I disliked but the basic standards were met: clean sheets, warm shower, nice and peaceful neighbourhood etc. Also the connetions to central London and Heathrow were good but tube ride takes some time (Golders Green, Nothern line, zone 3). The biggest cons were lousy breakfast, wornout furniture, early check-out time (10 am), narrow corridors and steep stairs (might not be suitable for disabled). It was also quite annoying that the cleanerâ€™s masterkey resets the lock. Therefore the key card had to be re-coded at the reception desk every day. All in all I would stay there again and might even recommend it with certain restrictions. I think that by London standards this hotel and itâ€™s price/quality ratio is acceptabe. In many other cities a hotel like this would be a bigger disappoinment.

Reviews.Title: “King Solomon Hotel, extremely basic”
Reviews.Author: articoky
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a hotel for one night and really just to sleep so it didn't matter about luxury. When I saw the King Solomon Hotel advertised at a very cheap price I thought I would take it. Having seen the hotel from the outside before I thought it would be decent. When I got there the receptionist was very unfriendly. I was surprised the first thing he told me was to pay before I had even seen the room. Then he proceeded to give me the key and told me 2nd floor. I asked if there was a lift and he said through the door. Low and behold there were a lot of steep very narrow stairs facing me. I struggled up to my floor with suitcase. Once I went into the room I realised why the price was so cheap. It was very small and just not up to scratch. The radiator didn't work and it was cold.
